drupalNodeEvent.title: Living as a Cog in the Machine: A Way of Life in the 1940s

field_description.processed: In the first half of 1940s, there emerged a new way of life within the Communist community in China. Young party members were encouraged to live as cogs in the machine of the Yan'an Rectification Movement. This paper attempts to illustrate some changes which occurred in the inner psychological world of young female Communists, in the marriage customs involving male cadres, and in the world of literature by using materials such as the diary of Mao Dun's daughter Shen Xia.
